meanings.definition: causing someone to lose focus or attention
meanings.sent1: The loud music was distracting during the test.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors on the wall were distracting me from my work.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was distracting the serious cat.
meanings.sent4: The constant honking of horns was distracting like a swarm of bees.
meanings.sent5: The flashing lights were so distracting that I couldn't concentrate at all.

meanings.definition: diverting someone's attention away from something
meanings.sent1: She tried distracting her friend by telling a joke.
meanings.sent2: The magician used a trick to distract the audience.
meanings.sent3: The clown was distracting the audience with funny faces.
meanings.sent4: The sudden noise distracted her like a surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The bright fireworks distracted everyone from the main event.

meanings.sent1: The loud construction noise was distracting during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The constant chatter in the room was distracting me from my work.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected dance performance was distracting in a good way.
meanings.sent4: The bright neon sign was distracting like a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of coffee was distracting and made me crave a cup.
